subSections.title: Definitions
Etymology 1
Noun
Derived terms
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ãã¬}}

Likely cognate with {{m|ja|çµ¹|tr=kinu||silk}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> Alternatively, may also be a compound of {{compound|ja|sort=ãã¬|ç€|tr1=ki|t1=wearing|pos1=the {{ja-etym-renyokei|nodot=1|ç€ã‚‹}} ''kiru'', â€œto wearâ€|å¸ƒ|tr2=nu|t2=cloth|pos2=shortened from normal reading ''nuno''}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

subSections.title: Noun
Derived terms
Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ã}}

The [[rendaku]] form of {{m|ja|ç€|tr=ki}}, the {{ja-etym-renyokei|nodot=1|ç€ã‚‹}} (''kiru'', â€œto wearâ€).<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref>

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: Only found as the latter element in compounds. More commonly spelled {{m|ja|ç€}}.

subSections.title: Etymology 4
Affix
Derived terms
Etymology 5
Usage notes
subSections.text: Not used in isolation. Only encountered in compounds.

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text: Cognate with mainland {{cog|ja|è¡£|tr=kinu}}.<ref>Katrien Hendrickx, The Origins of Banana-fibre Cloth in the Ryukyus, Japan, Leuven University Press: 2007, [https://books.google.com.au/books?id=ULyu8dNqS1sC&pg=PA110&dq=kimono+%22kinu%22++%E8%A1%A3 p 110]</ref><ref>http://www.haisai.co.jp/kantanuchinaaguchi.htm</ref> {{ryu-OG|31|ã¡ã‚“}}
